entries: You let loose a terrifying howl which affects every creature within 20 feet that can hear you. Each creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. A target automatically succeeds on this saving throw if it can't be {@condition frightened}.
On a successful save, the creature shrugs off the effect, but it's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of it's next turn.

On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you, and must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from you. The creature doesn't move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of it's turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature fails the saving throw by 10 or more, it also drops {@condition prone} after using it's reaction to move away from you.

spell.name: Summon Nightmare

m.text: the hoof of a pegasus worth at least 50 gp

entries: In a cloud of roiling smoke, a black nightmare horse appears from the shadow plane with its mane, tail, and hooves wreathed in flame. For the duration of the spell, you can ride the steed, and it will follow your verbal orders and directions. The creature uses the statistics for a Nightmare, but without the Ethereal Stride action.

While riding the Nightmare, you can use the Nightmare's speed to move on your own turn. The Nightmare can not move on its own, and does not have its own turns, but it can use its Hooves action immediately after your turn.
When the spell ends, the Nightmare immediately disappears, vanishing in a cloud of brimstone. The spell ends if you use an action to dismiss it, or if the Nightmare falls to 0 hit points.

spell.name: Magical Volley

components.m: one piece of ammunition or a thrown weapon

entries: You conjure a large array of ammunition or thrown weapons as duplicates of the original and fire them high into the sky. The ammunition or thrown weapons then pelt a 20-foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder within range. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity savin throw, taking {@damage 1d6} damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. The damage type is the same as that of the ammunition or weapon.
The pelted area on the ground also becomes difficult terrain until the beginning of your next turn, as the thrown weapons or ammunition linger for a moment before disappearing, stuck in the ground.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6}, and the radius of the cylinder increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Bursting Strike
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, a forceful explosion strikes the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it. Each creature affected must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d10} force damage on a failed save, and half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Enfeebling Strike
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, an injection of magical enfeebling poison is accompanied with the attack. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d8} poison damage, and it deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength until the spell ends. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not enfeebled.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.
